newsitem.title: KENYA: Portuguese aid worker murdered in Somalia.
newsitem.headline: Portuguese aid worker murdered in Somalia.

text.p: A Portuguese doctor with the aid agency Doctors Without Borders (MSF) was shot dead at a hospital in the central Somalian town of Baidoa, the agency said on Saturday.
Doctor Ricardo Marques, 35, was murdered on Friday morning for unknown reasons, MSF said in a statement.
He had joined the MSF team in Somalia last May.
No other details of the incident were immediately available.
Seven other MSF members were evacuated to Nairobi after the killing.
Since the U.N. operation pulled out in March 1995, only one other expatriate aid worker has been killed in Somalia -- an Italian doctor who was murdered in Merka, south of the capital Mogadishu.
Around 60 non-governmental expatriates and 40 U.N. workers remain in the country.

Baidoa, the epicentre of the 1992/93 famine, has been quiet in recent months, but there have been sporadic skirmishes outside the town between the Rahanweyne Resistance Army and militiamen loyal to faction leader Hussein Aideed.
Somalia has been without a central government since the fall of the late dictator Siad Barre in 1991.
